III. INVESTIGATION
There are no MIC findings.
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment
Description A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Staff sexually assaulted youth during a zoom hearing in the zoom
room. Staff alleged to bring knife into facility and threaten youth.
Investigation Allegation #1:
On 1/11/23, I spoke to Administrator 1 via telephone.
Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 has worked for the facility for
17 years and has not had issues in the past. Administrator 1
reported he removed Staff 1 from the current unit and placed him
on custodial duty as of right now. Administrator 1 reported this is
not the first time that Youth A has made these allegations towards
adults. Administrator 1 reported she had made familiar allegations
towards her attorney and made false police reports. Administrator
1 reported that on 1/10/23, Youth A had pulled a staff aside stating
she no longer wanted to go through with the allegations and
stated it was false, other than Staff 1 attempted to kiss her.
Administrator 1 reported there has not been a grievance filed by
any youth pertaining to these allegations.
All interviews were conducted with DHHS Worker 1 unless
otherwise noted.
On 1/12/23, I interviewed Youth A face to face at the facility. Youth
A reported that she made up all of the allegations. Youth A
reported that Staff 1 did not attempt to kiss her or touch her leg.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 has not expressed any affectionate
emotions towards her.
I interviewed Staff 1. Staff 1 reported he has not stated anything
inappropriate to Youth A or made any type of sexual advances
towards Youth A. Staff 1 reported he never talked to Youth A
about having a relationship with her.
I reviewed the video for 1/9/23, date of Youth A’s zoom court
hearing. Youth A does enter the room for her court hearing and is
walked to the room by Staff 1. Staff 1 never enters the room and
sits across the hallway until Youth A exits.
I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All training and clearances are
up to date. Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary in his file. I
reviewed Staff 1’s performance evaluations and there were no
issues noted.
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 1/10/23. It noted that Youth A
reported Staff 1 made sexual advancements towards here at her
zoom meeting on 1/9/23 at 11:00am. Youth A also noted that Staff
1 made sexual advances towards Youth C and Youth D.
2

Due to these allegations, interviews were completed with Youth C
and Youth D by courtesy DHHS Workers. Both Youth C and Youth
D were discharged from placement.
Youth C was interviewed by a courtesy DHHS Worker on 2/2/23.
Youth C reported she was touched by Staff 1 in her inner thigh
when she had a zoom court hearing. Youth C reported that Youth
D and Staff 1 were “sleeping together”, but Staff 1 and herself
were more of a “serious couple” than they (Staff 1 and Youth D)
were.
After interviews the police department became involved and
investigation was halted. On 3/13/23, police decided there were
no charges and gave permission to continue with the licensing
investigation.
Youth D reported that Staff 1 was never physically inappropriate
with her. Youth D reported she had never seen anything between
Staff 1 and Youth A or Youth C.
According to agency staff schedule and intake documents
obtained 3/7/23:
Youth C was admitted on 11/29/22 and placed on the quarantine
unit until 12/6/22. Staff 1 never worked on the quarantine unit.
Youth C’s court hearing was on 11/30/23. Staff 1 was not working
that day. The second court hearing was on 12/12/22 and a female
staff oversaw the zoom meeting that day.
Allegation #2:
On 1/12/23, I interviewed Youth A. Youth A reported that Staff 2
stated to her after she was restrained (unknown date or time),
“You are lucky you are not my daughter, or I would cut you up.”
Youth A reported she never saw Staff 2 with a knife only heard
from another youth that Staff 2 had a knife.
I interviewed Staff 2. Staff 2 reported he does not have a knife, nor
has he brought one into the facility. Staff 2 reported he did make a
statement to a youth stating, “I will fucking cut you.” Staff 2
reported he stated to the youth that he jumped up like he had a
“knife in his pocket”. Staff 2 reported the youth was playing cards
and was quite animated and jumped up quick.
3

Staff 2 reported that Youth A does make up allegations when she
is upset or doesn’t get her way. Staff 2 reported that this is why
staff, in general, are very cautious around her.
I interviewed Youth B. Youth B reported he has never seen Staff 2
with a knife and has never heard Staff 2 threaten anyone with a
knife.
On 2/2/23 in a CAC interview present by on call worker for
Maltreatment in Care Unit, Youth D reported she had never seen
Staff 2 with a knife or threaten anyone with a knife.
Staff 2’s performance evaluation did note that Staff 2 does “joke”
with the youth at times and that he needs to be more professional
in his interactions. Discipline was not done.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate that Staff 1 sexually assaulted
Youth A or Youth C. The video shows that Staff 1 never entered
the room with Youth A and Youth A reported she falsely made
allegations. Youth C reported Staff 1 touched her but there was no
evidence to validate this. The dates and times introduced by
Youth C did not line up with Staff 1’s attendance at work or times
that Youth C could have interacted with Staff 1. Staff 1 never
completed her zoom hearing and Staff 1 did not staff her in the
quarantine room.
There is no evidence to validate that Staff 2 brought a knife into
the facility or threatened youth with a knife. Youth A reported that
she made up the allegations and accused staff falsely.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
